entries.label: posterior segmental medullary artery
entries.definition: An artery that branches from the segmental spinal artery at certain vertebral levels and directly anastomoses with the posterior spinal arteries to reinforce the blood supply to the spinal cord.
entries.creator: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6677-8489
entries.justification: According to the AnatomyZone transcript, segmental medullary arteries branch from the segmental spinal artery at some (not all) vertebral levels and directly join the descending vertical arteries (anterior and posterior spinal arteries). They reinforce the blood supply provided by these vertical descending arteries. The segmental spinal arteries themselves arise from intercostal arteries (thoracic region) or lumbar arteries (lumbar region).

entries.label: segmental spinal artery
entries.definition: An artery that arises from vertebral, intercostal, or lumbar arteries depending on the spinal level, enters via the intervertebral foramina along with spinal nerve roots, and supplies blood to the spinal cord at each segmental level.
entries.creator: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6677-8489
entries.justification: According to AnatomyZone, segmental spinal arteries (also called 'feeder vessels') feed into the spinal cord at each different segmental level. In the cervical region, they arise from vertebral and deep cervical arteries; in the thorax from posterior intercostal arteries; and in the abdomen from lumbar arteries. They enter via the intervertebral foramina along with spinal nerve roots and then divide into posterior and anterior radicular arteries.

entries.label: segmental spinal artery #2
entries.definition: An artery that arises from vertebral, intercostal, or lumbar arteries depending on the spinal level, enters via the intervertebral foramina along with spinal nerve roots, and supplies blood to the spinal cord at each segmental level.
entries.creator: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6677-8489
entries.justification: Same as row 142 - this is another instance of a segmental spinal artery at a different vertebral level.

entries.label: sulcal artery
entries.definition: An artery that branches from the anterior spinal artery and penetrates into the anterior median fissure (ventral median fissure) to supply the central portions of the spinal cord.
entries.creator: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6677-8489
entries.justification: Sulcal arteries (also called anterior sulcal arteries or central arteries) are small penetrating branches that arise from the anterior spinal artery. They enter the spinal cord through the anterior median fissure (also called ventral median fissure) and supply blood to the central gray matter and inner portions of the white matter of the spinal cord. This is consistent with standard neuroanatomy references on spinal cord vasculature.
